thread.title: Daniel Sturridge gives Jurgen Klopp a boost as he returns to Liverpool training in time for Merseyside derby
thread.title_full: Daniel Sturridge gives Jurgen Klopp a boost as he returns to Liverpool training in time for Merseyside derby

author: Kristian Walsh
title: Daniel Sturridge gives Jurgen Klopp a boost as he returns to Liverpool training in time for Merseyside derby
text:
Sport Daniel Sturridge gives Jurgen Klopp a boost as he returns to Liverpool training in time for Merseyside derby The Reds take on their arch rivals Everton on Saturday and have received a boost as a certain player returns to training Share Look who's back (Photo: John Powell) Share Get Liverpool FC updates directly to your inbox + Subscribe Thank you for subscribing! Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email 
Liverpool boss Jurgen Klopp got a huge boost ahead of the Merseyside derby on Saturday as Daniel Sturridge returned to training. 
The England striker has had a wretched time with injuries and has not featured for Klopp's team since a 2-0 defeat at Hull in early February. 
He last started a game nine weeks ago, for a League Cup exit at the hands of Southampton but was finally out on the training pitch again on Thursday afternoon. 
Sturridge was initially sent home from the team's mid-season break in La Manga with a virus, before contracting a more serious complaint back on Merseyside. (Photo: John Powell) (Photo: John Powell) (Photo: John Powell) 
But after returning from a month-long hiatus to make a telling impact in the Goodison derby in December, hopes have been raised he could do similar again after his appearance at Melwood. 
Jordan Henderson is also battling to be fit for the derby, but was not pictured taking part in the session. 
Philippe Coutinho and Roberto Firmino were also snapped after their exploits on international duty with Brazil. (Photo: John Powell)
